text.section: A county, municipal corporation, or nonprofit organization sponsoring a project involving work specified in § 8-902 of this subtitle may apply to the Executive Director for a State grant to be applied toward the cost of that project.

An applicant may amend the project plans submitted with its application during or after the grant application process if the amendments are:
intended to meet the changing needs of the residential child care program or its residents; and
approved by the Executive Director.

On approval of a project and the project plans, the Executive Director shall:
promptly report the application to the Board of Public Works; and
recommend that the Board make funds available as provided in this subtitle.

The amount of the State grant recommended to the Board of Public Works for a project shall be determined after consideration of:
all eligible projects;
the total of unallocated State funds available at the time the grant recommendation is made to the Board of Public Works; and
the priorities established by the Office regarding geographic areas of the State identified as underserved by residential child care programs.
